description: List of all allowed actions. If provided, actions not listed here are not allowed.
label: action.allowed

description: Determines behaviour when creating a document.
label: Create Document Mode

possibleValues.description: Creates the document and opens it in a web app for the document format.

description: List of all disallowed actions. If provided, actions not listed here are allowed.
label: action.disallowed

description: List of all operating system activities that should be excluded from OS share sheets in actions such as Open In.
label: action.excludedSystemActivities

possibleValues.description: Save Image / Save Video / Save to camera roll

description: Determines how to open a document in a web app.
label: Open In WebApp mode

possibleValues.description: Open using `in-app-with-default-browser-option`, unless the respective endpoint is not available - in which case `default-browser` is used instead. If no endpoint to open the document is available, an error message is shown.
Open in default browser app. May require user to sign in.
Open inline in an in-app browser.
Open inline in an in-app browser, but provide a button to open the document in the default browser (may require the user to sign in).

description: Determines how the app opens shortcut files (ending in `.url`) app.
label: Open Shortcut mode

possibleValues.description: Open all shortcut files, targeting both links (web and other) and items.
Open only shortcut files that target items.
Open only shortcut files that target links (web and other).

description: URL for the app in the App Store.

description: Enable/disable UI animations.

description: OAuth2 Redirect URI.
label: authentication-oauth2.oa2-redirect-uri

description: OAuth2 token endpoint.

description: OpenID Connect Prompt
label: authentication-oauth2.oidc-prompt

description: OpenID Connect Redirect URI
label: authentication-oauth2.oidc-redirect-uri

description: Use OpenID Connect Dynamic Client Registration if the `.well-known/openid-configuration` provides a `registration_endpoint`. If this option is enabled and a registration endpoint is available, `oa2-client-id` and `oa2-client-secret` will be ignored.
label: authentication-oauth2.oidc-register-client

description: Client Name Template to use during OpenID Connect Dynamic Client Registration. In addition to the placeholders available for `http.user-agent`, `{{url.hostname}}` can also be used.
label: authentication-oauth2.oidc-register-client-name-template

description: OpenID Connect Scope
label: authentication-oauth2.oidc-scope

description: Omit Authorization Request Parameters - parameter names provided here are omitted from OAuth2 authorization requests.
label: authentication-oauth2.omit-authorization-parameters

description: Send Client ID and Client Secret in the body of POST requests to the token endpoint. As per RFC 6749 section 2.3.1, this should only be used if the token endpoint does not support receiving these via Basic authentication.
label: authentication-oauth2.post-client-id-and-secret

description: Alternative browser session class to use instead of `ASWebAuthenticationSession`. Please also see Compile Time Configuration if you want to use this.
label: authentication.browser-session-class

possibleValues.description: Replace `http` with `awb` and `https` with `awbs` to delegate browser sessions to the AirWatch browser.
Replace http and https with custom schemes to delegate browser sessions to a different app.
Replace `http` with `mibrowser` and `https` with `mibrowsers` to delegate browser sessions to the MobileIron browser.
Use UIWebView for browser sessions. Requires compilation with `OC_FEATURE_AVAILABLE_UIWEBVIEW_BROWSER_SESSION=1` preprocessor flag.

description: Indicates whether the app should ask iOS for a private authentication (web) session for OAuth2 or OpenID Connect. Private authentication sessions do not share cookies and other browsing data with the user's normal browser. Apple only promises that [this setting](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/authenticationservices/aswebauthenticationsession/3237231-prefersephemeralwebbrowsersessio) will be honored if the user has set Safari as default browser.
label: authentication.browser-session-prefers-ephermal

description: Overrides whether the default WebDAV endpoint should be probed to detect available authentication methods. By default, the necessity for this is determined dynamically.
label: authentication.skip-www-authenticate-checks

description: Controls prepopulation of the local database with the full item set during account setup.
label: bookmark.prepopulation

possibleValues.description: No prepopulation. Request the contents of every folder individually.
Parse the prepopulation metadata after receiving it as a whole.
Parse the prepopulation metadata while receiving it.

description: Controls whether the user can edit accounts.

description: List of disabled import methods that can't be used.

Disallow import through the Share Extension

description: Controls whether the app should prompt for an App Store review. Only applies if the app is branded.
label: branding.enable-review-prompt

description: Organization name to use throughout the app.
label: branding.organization-name

description: Indicates if the user can change the server URL for the account.

description: The name that should be used for the bookmark that's generated from this profile and appears in the account list.

label: Onboarding URL

label: URL

label: Feedback Email address

description: URL to open when selecting the "Send feedback" option. Allows the use of all placeholders provided in `http.user-agent`.
label: Feedback URL

description: Array of Dictionary, which should appear in the sidebar. Keys url and title are mandatory and an optional image can be added as either an SF-Symbol name (key: symbol) or the name of an image bundled with the app (key: image)
label: Sidebar Link Items

description: Title for the sidebar links section.
label: Sidebar Links Title

description: Values to use in system-color-based themes for branded clients. Mutually exclusive with theme-definitions.
label: Theme Colors

possibleKeys.description: Color to use as tint/accent color for controls (in hex notation).
Color to use as background color for brand views (in hex notation).
The status bar style in the setup wizard, affecting the status bar text color. Can be either `default`, `black` or `white`.
Color to fill file icons with (in hex notation).
Color to fill folder icons with (in hex notation).

description: CSS records to add to the CSS space of system-color-based themes for branded clients. Mutually exclusive with theme-definitions.
label: Theme CSS Records

label: branding.theme-definitions

description: URL to documentation for the app. Opened when selecting "Documentation" in the settings.
label: Documentation URL

description: URL to get help for the app. Opened when selecting "Help" in the settings.
label: Help URL

description: URL to get privacy information for the app. Opened when selecting "Privacy" in the settings.
label: Privacy URL

description: URL to terms of use for the app. Opened when selecting "Terms Of Use" in the settings.
label: Terms of use URL

description: URL of the instance theme.json file, which can contain instance or app specific branding parameter. Setting this to `auto` will construct the URL by adding `themes/owncloud/theme.json` to the respective server's base address.
label: URL of the theme.json

description: Default values for user defaults. Allows overriding default settings.
label: branding.user-defaults-default-values

description: Scheme to use instead of plain `http` when using browser session class CustomScheme, i.e. `mibrowser`.
label: browser-session.custom-scheme-plain

description: Scheme to use instead of `https` when using browser session class CustomScheme, i.e. `mibrowsers`.
label: browser-session.custom-scheme-secure

description: Set a custom app group identifier via Branding.plist parameter. This value will be set by fastlane. Changes OCAppGroupIdentifier, OCKeychainAccessGroupIdentifier and updates other, directly signing-relevant parts of the Info.plist. With this value set, fastlane needs the provisioning profiles and certificate with the app group identifier. This is needed, if a customer is using an own resigning script which does not handle setting the app group identifier.
label: build.app-group-identifier

description: Name of the URL scheme to use for private links. Must be provided in Branding.plist at build time. For documentation, please see https://github.com/owncloud/ios-app/blob/master/doc/BUILD_CUSTOMIZATION.md.
label: build.custom-app-scheme

description: Name of the URL scheme to use for OAuth2/OIDC authentication. Must be provided in Branding.plist at build time. The authentication redirect URI parameters must also be changed accordingly in Branding.plist and on the server side. For documentation, please see https://github.com/owncloud/ios-app/blob/master/doc/BUILD_CUSTOMIZATION.md.
label: build.custom-auth-scheme

description: A set of space separated flags to customize the build. Must be provided in Branding.plist at build time. For documentation, please see https://github.com/owncloud/ios-app/blob/master/doc/BUILD_CUSTOMIZATION.md.
label: build.flags

description: Set a custom app group identifier via Branding.plist parameter. This value will be set by fastlane. Changes OCAppGroupIdentifier, OCKeychainAccessGroupIdentifier only. Fastlane does not need the provisioning profile and certificate with the given app group identifer. Needs resigning with the correct provisioning profile and certificate. This is needed, if a customer is using an own resigning script which does not handle setting the app group identifier.
label: build.oc-app-group-identifier

description: Sets a custom version number for the app.
label: build.version-number

description: Controls if confidential related MDM settings can be overwritten.
label: confidential.allow-overwrite-confidential-mdm-settings

description: Controls whether screenshots are allowed or not. If not allowed confidential views will be marked as sensitive and are not visible in screenshots.
label: confidential.allow-screenshots

description: Controls if views which contains sensitive content contains a watermark or not.
label: confidential.mark-confidential-views

description: Allow the use of background URL sessions. Note: depending on iOS version, the app may still choose not to use them. This settings is overriden by `force-background-url-sessions`.
label: connection.allow-background-url-sessions

description: Allow the use of cellular connections.
label: connection.allow-cellular

description: Array of allowed authentication methods. Nil/Missing for no restrictions.
label: connection.allowed-authentication-methods

description: Controls whether private links are requested with regular PROPFINDs.
label: connection.always-request-private-link

description: Rule that defines the criteria that need to be met by a hostname other than a bookmark's hostname for the associated certificate to be added to the bookmark, tracked for changes and validated by the same rules as the bookmark's primary certificate. No value (default) or a value of `(0 == 1)` disables this feature. A value of `$hostname like "*.mycompany.com"` tracks the certificates for all hosts ending with mycompany.com.
label: connection.associated-certificates-tracking-rule

description: If a server does not provide `block_password_removal` information as part of its capabilities, this option provides the fallback value controlling whether passwords can (value: false) or can not (value: true) be removed from an existing link even if capabilities otherwise indicate passwords need to be enforced for links.
label: connection.block-password-removal-default

description:
Rule that defines the criteria a certificate needs to meet for OCConnection to recognize it as valid for a bookmark.

Examples of expressions:
- `bookmarkCertificate == serverCertificate`: the whole certificate needs to be identical to the one stored in the bookmark during setup.
- `bookmarkCertificate.publicKeyData == serverCertificate.publicKeyData`:  the public key of the received certificate needs to be identical to the public key stored in the bookmark during setup.
- `serverCertificate.passedValidationOrIsUserAccepted == true`: any certificate is accepted as long as it has passed validation by the OS or was accepted by the user.
- `serverCertificate.commonName == "demo.owncloud.org"`: the common name of the certificate must be "demo.owncloud.org".
- `serverCertificate.rootCertificate.commonName == "DST Root CA X3"`: the common name of the root certificate must be "DST Root CA X3".
- `serverCertificate.parentCertificate.commonName == "Let's Encrypt Authority X3"`: the common name of the parent certificate must be "Let's Encrypt Authority X3".
- `serverCertificate.publicKeyData.sha256Hash.asFingerPrintString == "2A 00 98 90 BD … F7"`: the SHA-256 fingerprint of the public key of the server certificate needs to match the provided value.
label: connection.certificate-extended-validation-rule

description: Endpoint to use for retrieving server capabilities.
label: connection.endpoint-capabilities

description: Path of the sharing recipient API endpoint.
label: connection.endpoint-recipients

description: Path of the remote shares API endpoint.
label: connection.endpoint-remote-shares

description: Path of the shares API endpoint.
label: connection.endpoint-shares

description: Endpoint to retrieve basic status information and detect an ownCloud installation.
label: connection.endpoint-status

description: Endpoint to use for retrieving information on logged in user.
label: connection.endpoint-user

description: Endpoint to use for WebDAV.
label: connection.endpoint-webdav

description: Endpoint to use for WebDAV metadata.
label: connection.endpoint-webdav-meta

description: Endpoint to as for WebDAV spaces.
label: connection.endpoint-webdav-spaces

description: Forces the use of background URL sessions. Overrides `allow-background-url-sessions`.
label: connection.force-background-url-sessions

description: The minimum server version required.
label: connection.minimum-server-version

description: Policy regarding the use of plain (unencryped) HTTP URLs for creating bookmarks. A value of `warn` will create an issue (typically then presented to the user as a warning), but ultimately allow the creation of the bookmark. A value of `forbidden` will block the use of `http`-URLs for the creation of new bookmarks.
label: connection.plain-http-policy

description: Array of authentication methods in order of preference (most preferred first).
label: connection.preferred-authentication-methods

defaultValue: (bookmarkCertificate.publicKeyData == serverCertificate.publicKeyData) OR ((check.parentCertificatesHaveIdenticalPublicKeys == true) AND (serverCertificate.passedValidationOrIsUserAccepted == true)) OR ((bookmarkCertificate.parentCertificate.sha256Fingerprint.asFingerPrintString == "73 0C 1B DC D8 5F 57 CE 5D C0 BB A7 33 E5 F1 BA 5A 92 5B 2A 77 1D 64 0A 26 F7 A4 54 22 4D AD 3B") AND (bookmarkCertificate.rootCertificate.sha256Fingerprint.asFingerPrintString == "06 87 26 03 31 A7 24 03 D9 09 F1 05 E6 9B CF 0D 32 E1 BD 24 93 FF C6 D9 20 6D 11 BC D6 77 07 39") AND (serverCertificate.parentCertificate.sha256Fingerprint.asFingerPrintString == "67 AD D1 16 6B 02 0A E6 1B 8F 5F C9 68 13 C0 4C 2A A5 89 96 07 96 86 55 72 A3 C7 E7 37 61 3D FD") AND (serverCertificate.rootCertificate.sha256Fingerprint.asFingerPrintString == "96 BC EC 06 26 49 76 F3 74 60 77 9A CF 28 C5 A7 CF E8 A3 C0 AA E1 1A 8F FC EE 05 C0 BD DF 08 C6") AND (serverCertificate.passedValidationOrIsUserAccepted == true))
description: Rule that defines the criteria that need to be met for OCConnection to accept a renewed certificate and update the bookmark's certificate automatically instead of prompting the user. Used when the extended validation rule fails. Set this to `never` if the user should always be prompted when a server's certificate changed.
label: connection.renewed-certificate-acceptance-rule

description: Controls whether 307 redirects are handled transparently at the HTTP pipeline level (by resending the headers and body).
label: connection.transparent-temporary-redirect

description: Allows fine-tuning the behavior of the connection validator by enabling/disabling aspects of it.
label: connection.validator-flags

possibleValues.description: Connection validation is triggered when receiving a responses with 502 status.
Clear all cookies for the connection when entering connection validation.

description: Path of the .well-known endpoint.
label: connection.well-known

description: Concurrency budgets available for sync actions by action category.
label: core.action-concurrency-budgets

description: Add an `Accept-Language` HTTP header using the preferred languages set on the device.
label: core.add-accept-language-header

description: Enable or disable per-process, in-memory cookie storage.
label: core.cookie-support-enabled

description: Override the availability signal, so the host is considered to always be in maintenance mode (`true`) or never in maintenance mode (`false`).
label: core.override-availability-signal

description: Override the reachability signal, so the host is always considered reachable (`true`) or unreachable (`false`).
label: core.override-reachability-signal

description: Minimum number of milliseconds until the next scan for changes, measured from the completion of the previous scan. If no value is provided, uses the poll interval provided in the server's capabilities (in milliseconds) if it is greater or equal 5 seconds. Defaults to 10 seconds otherwise.
label: core.scan-for-changes-interval

description: Provide hints that thumbnails are available for items whose MIME-Type starts with any of the strings provided in this array. Providing an empty array turns off thumbnail loading. Providing `["*"]` turns on thumbnail loading for all items.
label: core.thumbnail-available-for-mime-type-prefixes

description: Controls whether additional diagnostic options and information is available throughout the user interface.
label: diagnostics.enabled

description: Controls whether drag and drop should be prevented for items inside the app.
label: display.prevent-dragging-files

description: Controls whether hidden files (i.e. files starting with `.` ) should also be shown.
label: display.show-hidden-files

description: Controls whether folders are shown at the top.
label: display.sort-folders-first

description: List of all disallowed extensions. If provided, extensions not listed here are allowed.
label: extensions.disallowed

description: Controls whether the account content is available to other apps via File Provider / Files.app.
label: fileprovider.browseable

description: Active Host simulation extensions.
label: host-simulator.active-simulations

possibleValues.description: Lets all MOVE/COPY/DELETE/PUT requests fail with a timeout error.
Responds to all .well-known/webfinger requests with server-instance responses.
Return status code 404 for every request for the first five seconds.
Return status code 404 for every request.
Redirect any request without cookies to a bogus endpoint for 30 seconds, then to a cookie-setting endpoint, where cookies are set - and then redirect back.
Redirect any request without cookies to a cookie-setting endpoint, where cookies are set - and then redirect back.
Responds to all .well-known/webfinger requests with server-instance responses.

description: If request and response logging is enabled, the format to use.
label: http.traffic-log-format

description:
A custom `User-Agent` to send with every HTTP request.

The following placeholders can be used to make it dynamic:
- `{{app.build}}`: the build number of the app (f.ex. `123`)
- `{{app.version}}`: the version of the app (f.ex. `1.2`)
- `{{app.part}}`: the part of the app (more exactly: the name of the main bundle) from which the request was sent (f.ex. `App`, `ownCloud File Provider`)
- `{{device.model}}`: the model of the device running the app (f.ex. `iPhone`, `iPad`)
- `{{device.model-id}}`: the model identifier of the device running the app (f.ex. `iPhone8,1`)
- `{{os.name}}` : the name of the operating system running on the device (f.ex. `iOS`, `iPadOS`)
- `{{os.version}}`: the version of operating system running on the device (f.ex. `13.2.2`)
label: http.user-agent

description: The number of seconds that a file hasn't been downloaded, modified or opened after which the local copy is removed.
label: item-policy.local-copy-expiration

description: Controls whether local copies should automatically be removed after they haven't been downloaded, modified or opened for a period of time.
label: item-policy.local-copy-expiration-enabled

description: Number of seconds since the removal of an item after which the metadata entry may be finally removed.

description: Enables/disables App Store licensing support.

description: Enables/disables Enterprise licensing support.

description: Dictionary with localization overrides where the key is the English string whose localization should be overridden, and the value is a dictionary where the keys are the language codes (f.ex. "en", "de") and the values the translations to use.

description: Maximum length of a log message before the message is truncated. A value of 0 means no limit.

description: If set, omits logs messages containing any of the exact terms in this array.

description: If set, omits all log messages tagged with tags in this array.

description: If set, omits all log messages not tagged with tags in this array.

description: Controls whether certain objects in log statements should be masked for privacy.

description: Controls whether messages spanning more than one line should be logged as a single line, after replacing new line characters with "\n".

description: Controls whether messages spanning more than one line should be broken into their individual lines and each be logged with the complete lead-in/lead-out sequence.

description: Controls whether log messages should be written synchronously (which can impact performance) or asynchronously (which can loose messages in case of a crash).

description: Use Server Locator

possibleValues.description: Locate server via lookup table. Keys can match against the beginning (f.ex. "begins:bob@"), end (f.ex. "ends:@owncloud.org") or regular expression (f.ex. "regexp:")
Locate server via Webfinger service-instance relation (http://webfinger.owncloud/rel/server-instance) using the entered/provided server URL

description: List of settings (as flat identifiers) users are allowed to change. If this list is specified, only these settings can be changed by the user.
